In my summer travels across #Ohio, I learned a lot from #Ohioans about their priorities & what they need from the federal gov. This fall, I‚Äôll continue to fight for all #Ohioans & make sure we‚Äôre passing legislation that makes a positive difference in people‚Äôs lives.

My travels across Ohio also allowed me to meet with farmers, the backbone of an agricultural industry that contributes more than $100 billion to #Ohio‚Äôs economy every year. We discussed how heavy storms have hurt the ag. community this year & the need to pass #USMCA.

I also met w/ a number of groups working to combat the addiction crisis across #Ohio. State & local organizations have been able to use federal resources provided by laws like my #CARA and #CURES to design innovative approaches to preventing and treating addiction.

I discussed my bipartisan #JOBSAct with community colleges, high school #CTE programs, and businesses all across #Ohio, as it will help close the skills gap and get more individuals into short-term training programs.

I met with #smallbiz owners who told me how they‚Äôve benefited from the major #taxreform law enacted in 2017. They‚Äôve used their tax savings to grow their businesses, increase wages for their workers, & hire more employees. We also discussed the need for skilled workers.

It was a great opportunity to learn more about the priorities of Ohioans across the state & how DC can help. I was able to see firsthand how some of the laws I‚Äôve passed are working to address the #opioidepidemic & expand workforce training. #SORGrants #CARA #STOPACT #JOBSAct
